intro: Phyllanthus thymoides var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora in its native habitats.
